title: FC Melun
text:
Football Club de Melun is a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club located in <a href="Melun">Melun</a>, France. As of the 2021–22 season, it competes in the <a href="R%C3%A9gional%202">Régional 2</a>, the seventh tier of French football.
History.
The club was founded as US Melun in 1894.
In the 1970s and 1980s, the club competed mostly in the <a href="French%20Division%203%20%281971%E2%80%931993%29">Division 3</a>, but reached the <a href="Ligue%202">Division 2</a> on two occasions, during the <a href="1977%E2%80%9378%20French%20Division%202">1977–78</a> and <a href="1987%E2%80%9388%20French%20Division%202">1987–88</a> seasons. The second occasion the club reached the Division 2, it was as <a href="Entente%20Melun-Fontainebleau%2077">Entente Melun-Fontainebleau 77</a>, the club that formed from a merger in 1987 between <a href="RCP%20Fontainebleau">CS Fontainebleau</a> and US Melun. However, in 1988, the Entente split, and Melun merged with Dammarie-lès-Lys to create a new club called in Sporting Melun-Dammarie 77. In 1992, the club took the new name of FC Melun and was administratively relegated several divisions.
